Configuration summary: Quantity (1), Storage for each RDS instance (Provisioned IOPS SSD (io1)), Storage amount (500 GB), Provisioning IOPS (10000), Instance type (db.m5.large)
Operating system (Linux), Quantity (8), Storage for each EC2 instance (Provisioned IOPS SSD (io1)), Storage amount (200 GB), Provisioning IOPS (3000), Instance type (t3a.2xlarge)
S3 Standard storage (1000 GB per month)
Number of EC2 instances (8), Number of EIPs per instance (1), Number of EIP remaps (40)

Group hierarchy: Overall, I anticipate less volume. So I downgrade the EC2 instance family to t series for cheaper cost and reduce provision iops. I also removed the db replica as less read operations expected. I reduce EC2 and RDS because those two services are most costly and impactful.
